programme.title: Antim The Final Truth
programme.desc: Antim: The Final Truth is an action-drama film that portrays the conflict between a fierce cop and a ruthless gangster who rises from poverty and becomes a threat to the system. As their worlds collide, the film explores themes of power, morality, and the consequences of violence. Starring Salman Khan and Aayush Sharma, the movie delivers intense action sequences and emotional depth.

programme.title: Article 15
programme.desc: Article 15 is a hard-hitting investigative drama inspired by real events, focusing on the caste-based injustices prevalent in India. When a young Dalit girl is found murdered and another goes missing, a newly posted IPS officer, Ayan Ranjan (played by Ayushmann Khurrana), takes on the case. As he digs deeper, he is faced with bureaucratic resistance, local hostility, and systemic corruption. The film, directed by Anubhav Sinha, is a powerful commentary on the social divide and is titled after the Indian Constitution's Article 15, which prohibits discrimination on the grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Directed by Abbas Mustan, Race features Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna as rival brothers in the horse racing business. With twists and turns at every corner, the film delves into themes of greed and betrayal, keeping audiences guessing until the end.

programme.title: Kanjoos Makkichoos
programme.desc: Jamuna Prasad Pandey, known for his frugality, saves diligently to send his parents on a pilgrimage. However, when they go missing during a flood, he battles bureaucratic corruption to claim compensation, leading to a series of comedic and emotional events.

programme.title: Gadar 2
programme.desc: Directed by Anil Sharma, Gadar 2 continues the saga of Tara Singh (Sunny Deol) and Sakeena (Ameesha Patel). Set against the backdrop of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, the film follows Tara's daring mission to save his imprisoned son, Jeete, blending intense action with emotional depth.
